column3: Paul persuaded me to join the band. I would never have had the courage otherwise. It was fun at the beginning. We were playing just for fun, with Paul's group.
Physical bravery is an animal instinct; moral bravery is much higher and truer courage.
I know that if I'd had to go and take an exam for acting, I wouldn't have got anywhere. You don't take exams for acting, you take your courage.
You cannot build character and courage by destroying men's initiative and independence.

What has made America amazing has been the fact that throughout our history, throughout the more than 200 years of our history, there have been men and women of courage who stood up and decided it was more important to look out for the future of their children and their grandchildren than their own political futures.

I'm not a fighter, but I would love to be a boxer because I love the courage and toughness. I mean, there can be nothing more terrifying than walking into an arena and looking at Mike Tyson in the ring.
Make-up is the last thing to enhance your beauty, but it's very important because it builds up your self-confidence and gives you more courage.

At my aunt's funeral, I promised myself that I wouldn't be bound by the belief that I'm supposed to stay in anything - whether it's a relationship, a job, a house, or a circumstance - if it makes me miserable. She gave me the courage to find my own happiness.
Parents do not have the courage to say no to certain things that their children demand. They are rather scared of their children.

My first and most loved real novel was 'Little Women.' I identified with the Jo character even though we were opposites. Jo was very strong-minded and brave, and I was shy and kind of a wuss, everyplace but in my own home. I wanted to be Jo. She was my alter ego. I think reading that book gave me courage.
I pray they will carry on in spite of that dreadful monster prejudice, and with patience, courage, fortitude and perseverance achieve success for themselves.
I think there's a difference between ditzy and dumb. Dumb is just not knowing. Ditzy is having the courage to ask!
He who has faith has... an inward reservoir of courage, hope, confidence, calmness, and assuring trust that all will come out well - even though to the world it may appear to come out most badly.
Courage is doing what you are afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you are scared.
Who asks whether the enemy was defeated by strategy or valor?
Courage is on display every day, and only the courageous wring the most out of life.
The secret to happiness is freedom... And the secret to freedom is courage.
The best protection any woman can have... is courage.
Presumption should never make us neglect that which appears easy to us, nor despair make us lose courage at the sight of difficulties.
It is curious that physical courage should be so common in the world and moral courage so rare.
One man scorned and covered with scars still strove with his last ounce of courage to reach the unreachable stars; and the world will be better for this.
Courage is... the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
I never thought much of the courage of a lion tamer. Inside the cage he is at least safe from people.
A leader must have the courage to act against an expert's advice.
Audacity augments courage; hesitation, fear.
There can be no great courage where there is no confidence or assurance, and half the battle is in the conviction that we can do what we undertake.
